Gx32lQ-jgKDUzBgFwiIQdQ.text: Pamela's has been my favorite brunch place in Pittsburgh since I moved here seven years ago. I don't have a favorite location. They're all great and all have the same great menu. Huge portions. I always have leftovers to take home for the next meal.

9gWR1PbZn8p1-C0QoNjaYQ.text: Onions in the hash browns, and a 10 inch peice of hair in my breakfast sandwich. I don't come to Pittsburgh much and don't plan on returning but if I do, I will never come here again.

4Asaakwobko5flQThCx0Hw.text: Visiting pitt to see my one and only's brother graduate, we weren't invited to the honors ceremony. Thankfully, it was morning so I could try some breakfast foods (my favorite kind of foodz).   Got there early so there was no wait. Sat down, looked at the small menu and decided on the strawberry crepe pancakes, a side of potatoes and bacon. When I eat breakfast, I do it right, ya'll.   Food came out quick and was delicious, although the cafeteria style bacon was not my fav. But-the potatoes. OH THE POTATOES. get them. Do yourself a favor. The pancakes were thin but the strawberries, brown sugar and whipped cream complimented them so nicely, i didn't even need syrup.  Cash only, but errbody already said that.

-vhqbCqKNSjKJubSYopCMw.text: Strawberry hotcakes is a must, try the morning after breakfast special with some eggs and meat!! It's very filling so bring your appetite!! If that's not enough try it with their famous potatoes!! It's also got a nice retro vibe, staff seems very friendly as well.

4BpqYeoOFuZP5reaPzKdbA.text: Pamela's was, alongside Primanti's, the place everyone said I must try when I moved here. And this one really delivers.  The food is very reasonably priced, and has a unique selection. Virtually everything can come with their delicious, buttery crepe pancakes, which are thin and amazing, or their lyonaise potatoes, which are outstanding, especially if you are a potato lover like myself. There are a lot of other good choices, like the Tex Mex omelet or the Croissant French Toast, and as I said above the prices are pretty good. The layout is odd and there is a lot of kitschy board games and such on the wall that kind of make it fun and different.  There are a few drawbacks. Their hours are short, and I've not found the help to be especially attentive. Not bad, mind you, just not especially attentive. Also, they only take cash, which is a pain when you don't typically carry cash.  This place is good enough that it is usually the first stop when we have visitors from out of town.

_LoP8VdvJ9oq9A3iItPfRg.text: Favorite breakfast food in oakland... the hotcakes are to die for. It's a fun place for families, as the walls are covered with old school board games and the tables come with trivia cards. It is a very popular spot on campus so there can sometimes be a bit of a wait, but they turn tables pretty quickly.

6aQEHDCV3EvVEXZ0OWi-bg.text: We came here for breakfast that was just down the street for the hotel we were staying at. There were 8 of us, so the wait was about 20 minutes, but not bad considered how busy the place was.  We were asked several times about drinks, so the wait staff has that locked up, and we were left wondering if that's where they make their money like the bars, idk. I did like the large orange juice that was served in a good size cup. The waitress who took our order also brought us a pitcher of water without us having to ask, which was much appreciated.  I ordered the breakfast special that came with their signature crepe hot cakes. Bacon was good, scramble eggs were good, and hot cakes were good. Nothing really special, but a solid breakfast.  They are cash only, but that doesn't seem to be an issue considering how crowded it was, and also being mainly a breakfast/brunch establishment understandable since it probably won't run you more than $10-15 per person.

E8T_KIjiWPBjJji3pbSKiw.text: OK, let's get one thing straight first.  You're not allowed to call yourself a "diner" if you close at 3 or 4 in the afternoon.  You're barely a low-end cafe.  If I can't get breakfast for dinner, you don't belong anywhere NEAR the diner category--and at Pamela's, you can't get ANYTHING for dinner, because they're not even open.  So change the name.  Now onto the food.  When I first moved to Pittsburgh, I couldn't wait to try this place.  I love brunch, and the rave reviews had me salivating.  And my first trip was pretty good!  The stuffed crepes are really tasty.  The line on weekends is out of control, but I thought it was understandable if my first dish was representative of their offerings.  Spoiler Alert: It was not.  Every subsequent visit has been a massive disappointment.  The salads are mediocre; the sandwiches are nothing special; the sides are middling at best; and their "chorizo" tastes like a frozen school cafeteria sausage patty pan-fried with a pack of Ortega taco spices.  That people will wait even a few minutes for anything but the stuffed crepes is a mind-boggling mystery, and the hours people spend lingering outside these doors say more about the sad state of local brunch offerings than anything about the cuisine inside.  They do one thing well, and it's the only reason for the second star on this rating.  So if you're in the mood for stuffed crepes and the line isn't long, by all means, hit up Pamela's.  I won't be coming back until they change the menu, the name, and/or the hours.

v0AZYzETJAwHKt-enrnTdA.text: One of God's gifts to this world. Highly recommend the Tex-Mex Omelet if you aren't feeling the phenomenal specialty hotcakes!! H2P, hail2pamelas

jgH3uO8tGV2WbzJLkQJ_-Q.text: Great food but I wouldn't wait in the long lines of students and their parents during visiting weekends. The crepe style pancakes are definitely the best (but make sure you split an order... one pancake each or you'll die of a heart-attack or overly stuffed stomach). The "Morning After" is the best deal... standard breakfast combo, two pancakes, two eggs, and your choice of a meat. If you have a normal appetite and a normal-sized stomach... SPLIT one or two between two or three people. Unless you like left over breakfast.

gwMQugcb5skT0YjfOZzaqw.text: Great and cheap. The tex mex omelet is awesome and filling, and the trivia cards at each table are an entertaining touch

hXw68se_r-JVQN1BdYiPLg.text: This place is not bad. Typical diner food, it is what it is. Best thing I ate were the strawberry hotcakes, essentially strawberry crepes. Pretty tasty. They serve what may be the worst coffee I've ever tasted though.  Cash only! But they were pretty friendly and understanding when we had to leave to get cash to pay for our meal.   Is it worth a eating here? If you're passing by, sure. But I wouldn't make a big effort to eat here either.

zdCOgE8CkQ0fPi-cvjYDaw.text: Good solid diner. Nice staff. Food was too notch. The building needs more adequate air conditioning but beyond that it's a winner.

QarKEX8aVbbylPlsjSS6cw.text: One of the worst breakfast experiences I have ever had.  This was recommended to me by someone whom I thought was my friend, he is dead to me now.  The eggs were clearly some kind of powdered or boxed egg product.  The bacon was that precooked paper thin junk that you microwave and serve at a school cafeteria.  I should have know from my first sip of their almost undrinkable instant coffee that this was a bad decision.  Please learn from my mistake and save yourself a stomach ache.

7_wBLeYgSGvZgIK8S7ZZ8Q.text: Wow, Took my family to Pamela's the day we dropped my son at Pitt for his freshman year. He said he wasn't hungry but ended up finishing the Morning After special. I can't really criticize though, because so did I. Every item was perfect. Eggs over were cooked properly and the home fried potatoes were spot on. Surprisingly the pancakes were still delicious even though I saved them for last and was pretty full already. Best breakfast out that I have had in some time. I will definitely be back. I read a number of reviews and truly don't get all the three's.  By the way, service was friendly and attentive even during the morning rush. I love that they only accept cash or the school's panther money.

_KnMAnyqjIfmZGRFOuAuUg.text: This is a great spot on Sunday even though it's a lil crowded. They have a wide variety of breakfast food .... Omelet a for me. I must say a turn off was the lady coughing that took the order.

dhUzTpeysxi3zGd2cdf4fQ.text: Blueberry hotcakes actually had fresh blueberries, and were really good. Went at 3p on Saturday and no wait.

4ilxgxM67vIQRCCGB2GMXQ.text: I much prefer the Pamela's in the strip. I've only been here once, but the food was beyond salty. Even the potatoes that I love were super salty and oily. Maybe I just went on an off day, but I'll be going to the one in the strip only from now on.

jj2GFY3_n2OoWC1WDRrXEQ.text: Just there today and I've been there numerous times in the past. Up until today I've never had a bad experience with anything I've ordered until today.  I ordered the bacon and cheese omelette, which I've had before and enjoyed. When I started it everything was fine, but as I started to get into it I noticed that the bacon was so fatty that I had to spit it out- multiple times. I eventually started playing around with my fork to inspect the bacon and could clearly see the fatty pieces in there.   I would expect more from such a popular and well run place, as I'm sure that the fatty bacon would have been seen in prep or in cooking the omelette if the kitchen staff was paying attention.  The only reason I didn't give them a one is because the service was pretty good and the potatoes and toast accompanying my omelette were up to their usual standards.   Despite the bad experience I'm more than willing to give them another chance as they've earned that with a dozen good trips there in the past versus just one bad meal.

aJr9r9T-uaaVvkQ9u5zFKA.text: This is my go-to spot for breakfast in Pittsburgh! I love how it is in campus and very close to my school. I always order their strawberry hotcake with no wip as I am very self-conscious about my sugar intake.  I have been here many times with friends and they usually like what they get. Last time I have been here the waitress gave us the wrong change and when we asked her for the right change she was offended like if we are lying to her. I was upset because some one else (another waitress or staff) was staring at us like if we did something wrong and it was humiliating :( especially that I am the one who suggested Pamela's for my sister who were visiting Pittsburgh for the first time.    I have not been there since then but I really love Pamela's so I hope the management  train the employees better on how to handle these situations

qj2UD8VM_4uQGFotX4Nr0w.text: Definitely a good place for breakfast!! Very good potatoes would go here just for the potatoes. But very bad that they dont accept card and just accept cash. I want to go many times but I stop myelf just because I dont keep cash so much :(

nsMzLHuW_-y9Xqeus4FYKQ.text: Great start! Our wait was short and very organized. Loved the text when table is ready. Waited about 30 mins for food. A little long for breakfast but food was very good.

p528FxuskWfAUVVzcS80vw.text: The food was ok. Pancakes always good. My fish sandwich and fries were fair. Service? what service? we had 4 different people come to our table with no communication between them. 2 people to take a drink order, 1 to take the food order and the a food runner, (who actually put the food on the table, hid the check with the menus and ran. Never saw anyone again. No check back, not refills, nothing....I know the policy about paying in cash but then they never tally the check so that it is difficult to make sure you have enough cash on hand. Also you can't check the total charge for accuracy.

N42AAplxmenuBprosGY6xQ.text: I was in Pittsburgh for 4 days and I ate here two of those days.  The hot cakes are what brought me back.  The first time, I got the strawberry ones.  Fresh, cold strawberries smothered with brown sugar and freshly made whipped cream wrapped in a buttery, fluffy, and slightly salty hot cake.  So. Freaking. Good.  Round 2: Fresh bananas smothered in chocolate and wrapped in a buttery, fluffy, and slightly salty hot cake.  So. Freaking. Good.  It was a bit hectic going in the morning -- they have an early bird special which has really good deals until like 8am or something.  But the second time I went, I went at around 2pm and it was super empty.  The service at 2pm was good though -- super friendly people.  Highly recommended!

dNZNK2ywEVC-e_7e395rWw.text: Absolutely delicious food. Huge portions and not badly priced. I had the croissant french toast and loved every bite! I will say that they were very busy when we went on a Saturday, but the wait time went pretty quick and the food was brought out fast.   Since they are so busy, the tables are pretty close together and they really pack the people in. But, if you don't mind being in close quarters with others, you will totally love it here!

sta0KF__9nMAWyick07Djw.text: I hadn't been here in years, but Pamela's was just as delicious - and perhaps even more so - than I remembered from my last visit as a Pitt student back in 2012. We went on a Monday morning, there was no wait, and service was excellent and quick; It was a stark contrast from how busy it can be on the weekends. We ordered: a "morning after" with banana chocolate chip pancakes, an omelette, and a buffalo chicken salad. All were delicious, and all were large portions.  On the salad, the house made vinaigrette was delicious, and the fries were a deliciously crunchy addition for only $1 extra. Maybe don't use all of your dressing though - mixed with all of the buffalo sauce the bottom of the salad ended up a little too wet. The pancakes were perfect- thin, crisp on the edges, and perfectly chewy on the inside. They're a little sweet with the bananas and chocolate chips added, but if you ordered that you were probably looking for sweet in the first place and will be pleased.  c a s h o n l y. There's a First National Bank ATM on the block outside.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Omelette
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Salad

WKCDOkvsi9DyJ0AA-NMfvg.text: pamela's is a staple of pittsburgh brunch. their omelets and their hot cakes are great, and everything is reasonably priced (and cash only!)  the wait staff are friendly, though occasionally a bit rushed because it's always crowded on weekends. on my latest visit, they offered to make us peanut butter banana hot cakes off menu because they had the peanut butter chips left over from the last week's specialty hot cakes and they were amazing. i fell in love with corned beef hash through Pam's but their omelets good and their potatoes are especially delightful. other favorites include the strawberry hot cakes and the Tex Mex omelet!  it can get loud and crowded here every weekend between 10-12. download the nowait app or use yelp to check yourself in first before you arrive, you'll thank yourself when you walk right in past the crowds!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. corned beef hash with scrambled eggs and peanut butter banana hot cakes!

vASMAtUwegSfz0ka_ZaQ7g.text: Came here Sunday noon. Packed. A huuuuge line waiting outside. We waited for 30 mins. Peak hours, this place is always filled to the brim, so prepare accordingly. By 1:30, however, the place empties out, making it a perfect time to visit.  Typical Dinner atmosphere. Super casual. Very loud. Super high noise level. Prepare to talk really loudly. Cash only. Pay at the cashier by the exit after your meal.   Lunch options on the menu are not served on Sunday.  Super long food wait. Our waiter might've forgot to give our order to the kitchen. Came in to ask us if we ordered, 20 mins after we placed our order. We were starving by the time our food arrived.   Got chorizo & 2 eggs ($9.25) and corned beef hash & 2 eggs ($9.25). Hearty portions that are served with toast. I got toast substituted for tomato slices. Chorizo was good, nothing crazy. Corned beef hash with two scrambled eggs & cheese was tasty. Huge pile of hash. Well seasoned, not too salty. Enjoyed the meal.   Overall, nothing extraordinary, but a solid breakfast option. More sweet than savory options on the menu, so a good snack/sweet tooth satisfier option.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu. Lunch options aren&#39;t served on Sundays
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu. Lunch options aren&#39;t served on Sundays
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo hash cheese scrambled eggs $9.25. Nothing extraordinary

VHRDZOxU7lDpJoTm2WjD1g.text: Not sure what all the hype is about. Heavy handed with the fat products doesn't make the food taste better. Cash only is a PIA and not worth it if the food is this poor.

rbzyS0yNrOUY14Qrl5uM7A.text: Stopped in for breakfast as i was in town for work. It's walking distance from the Hilton garden inn. I was seated immediately and the service was friendly and fast. I only waited 5 min for food which was amazing. I'll definitely be back again if I'm in the area. I had an omelette with a side of fruit and both were amazing. If you are looking for a great place for a quick breakfast, this is your place. Typical diner decor, friendly people, fair prices. Also, they only take cash.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vH6ZKS_FKzAgW0DteVCgVA.text: It's a diner, through and through.  We had a decent breakfast and the prices were reasonable.   The place is loud pretty loud, so yeah, no business lunches.   Please know it's cash only as well.  The service was friendly and quick.  I really loved the old games on the wall.  We shared a spinach/feta/tomato omelet and it was excellent.  If we lived in the area, we would be back for sure.

1s2Ho3A5F-o4uKzgv5E7AQ.text: Pamela's diner is a great and reliable breakfast spot! It's in a good location and gets great business. The prices are very reasonable and it's impossible to leave hungry! Highly recommend if you're in the area!

79oBbfcRiv8rJrsHGMsdrw.text: The pancakes here are like no other. Light, airy, crispy goodness. Get the toping or fruit of your choice, and enjoy.

yAnLWLNRY4Kvo3007bprrQ.text: Best pancakes ever!!!service is good and fast the only thing is no credit card..cornbeef hashbrown is awesome

xwD4VRwFYJY5ag82yHwJYA.text: The pancakes are where it's at. If you don't order the pancakes, you won't understand what makes the place so popular.  Pamela's is a decent diner with great service. The food isn't really great, and it's not bad. It gets the job done. It has a refreshing old fashioned vibe to it in an age of every restaurant copying Chipotle or sticking mason jars and bare wood tables.  But when you get the pancakes, you understand what makes Pamela's special. They have this type of Crepe/Pancake hybrid and it's really delicious.  So check out Pamela's, and get a pancake. Otherwise, you're wasting your time.

UGq0ITYMmQ0fQpp9hTWxew.text: Enjoyed our first visit. The pancakes had a great taste. Daughter enjoyed her salad. Service was friendly. Expect we will be back. Also note it was cash only.

YL8Dm3tEyu4XLwOOHEnHEw.text: (we're behind on reviews, this is from a visit in March 2018)  He Said: I've been to two locations and both have been great.  I'm pretty easy: I want some corned beef hash or scrapple, a couple of runny eggs, and toast. Pamela's delivers.  It was a short walk from our hotel and a nice way to start our hockey day.  Busy?  Sure, but whatever.  A little patience never hurt anyone.    She Said: He and I stopped in for breakfast while the teens slept in. We were expecting it to be way busier than it was. I think we hit the sweet spot with our timing because a line was definitely forming as we walked out. My breakfast was exactly what I expect from a diner: filling and good. The tea was a notch or two above Lipton, which was appreciated. I had Gail's Favorite Eggs, and they were scrambled perfectly. The Lyonnaise potatoes were creamy and tasty--I wish I'd asked for them extra crispy, but I certainly wasn't NOT going to eat them. They were my favorite part of the meal, by far. The bread was above average, and I left with a full stomach and no regrets.  Potty Points: No trip to the potty for me on this visit!

nDjs_Hk-AAdAit17kvSj8Q.text: This is a great spot for breakfast! CASH ONLY! We got there at 8:30 AM and there was no wait on a Sunday. Our server was very friendly and took our order quickly. The crepe hotcakes were a must have and they are delicious. They are a hybrid of pancakes and hashbrowns. We also ordered the chorizo with baked potatoes and a vegetarian omelette. Both of these were also excellent but heavy. Overall, a good brunch place, hearty food and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Omelet
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo eggs and baked potatoes
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pamela&#39;s Famous Crepe Hotcakes

o3wlkLzQ_cJ5b6FkD6JuFA.text: I usually always enjoy eating at Pamela's because it's always for a special occasion. This time it was a brunch to catch up with friends. I love love love love love their breakfast home fries and have been tempted (on several occasions) to order just a plate of their potatoes. SO GOOD. The rest of the food was just okay. I got the chorizo with 2 eggs and wheat toast. I think they're slightly overpriced for diner food AND also for being cash only.   We each ordered something different and though we enjoyed our food, the service today was really bad. It was busy but one of us had asked for OJ and the waitress totally forgot about it. Another waitress had to take our orders because our original waitress was preoccupied. And then when we wanted a box to take our leftovers, it took for freaking ever to flag down anyone to ask for a box.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EYLC4qUz9BmJyK-XPyH9QQ.text: My friend came into town for the weekend so we decided to do to a diner for some breakfast. Pamela's is the only one I know that is close to Oakland and I've heard so many good things about the place so I took him there. We got there around what seemed like rush hour for breakfast (around 11:30) but we only had to wait about 20 minutes before being seated. For how busy they were, they were very speedy with helping us get our drinks and ordering at a timely order. They have so many great things on their menu but I knew I mostly wanted eggs and bacon so I went with their Morning After Breakfast Special with hotcakes and my friend got their Western omelet with potatoes. It was a very delicious meal that we both enjoyed. The hotcakes are pretty thin but big and come with two so it's still pretty filling. It would have complimented greatly with some Nutella. I tried my friends potatoes and was extremely impressed. The addition of onions and spices they add to the potatoes give it a great taste. It was a relatively cheap meal as each of ours was less than $9 and came with a lot of food. I see now why so many of friends like this place so much.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Morning After Special (also comes with eggs, choice of ham, sausage, bacon)
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Morning After Breakfast Special (also comes with hotcakes)

4XpXIjZdRcBdPRysz-qqtQ.text: We were looking for breakfast during a visit and stumbled across this place. It is a classic diner with a 50's decor, and had quite a crowd on Saturday morning. They were able to seat us immediately, though we almost had a wait. The hot cakes here are amazing! We had strawberry, blueberry (the special that day), chocolate  chip, and banana chocolate chip. All were amazing and topped with freshly made whipped cream. Serving sizes were hugs, so plan to share if you have a smaller appetite. Service was fast, efficient, and courteous. The only negative is that they are CASH ONLY, so make sure to have enough with you. (Expect about $15 per person for meal, drink and tip.)

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana Chocolate Chip Hot Cakes

-wyCf_LPcDs8axrg5dGejQ.text: We the morning after and on of the specialty hot cakes banana and chocolate.  The crepe hot cakes are thin.  Soft in the middle and crunchy on the edges.  Very good!  The service was good and they came by several time to top off my coffee.  Would definitely come back.

Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast

qa8abHdJAhq9RV6Wqgm-1g.text: P&G Pamela's is a very good place for breakfast. Even though it was Father's Day, and extremely busy. The staff worked very hard to keep everyone happy. Not only were you checked on by your server, but every server asked if you were okay. I have always liked going to this Pamela's. You're not only treated like a guest, but as if you're part of the family.

55-OK5vLwpw5X4nu9FCy3g.text: Wow definitely loved this place. Full of culture and very unique. You notice the detail and the time they put in as soon as you walk in. I'm visiting from San Diego but no matter where your from they make you feel at home. The food is very different so it doesn't feel like just any other diner. I got the the roasted turkey breast sandwich. It was good enough to enjoy but the bread wasn't as fresh as it should've been. It was cold turkey between hamburger buns with lettuce and Tomato with a side of fries for $9. I just think they could have made it a lot better, although it was still enjoyable. We also got a turkey sausage and egg sandwich that was simply delicious. I definitely still recommend this place, great for a late breakfast or early lunch. Enjoy :)

Bdwrly3K3eyH7ZFTl32nfg.text: Cheap breakfast diner. Ambience inside is a bit cheesy and the food is not gourmet by any means, but I'd say that this is a quintessential Pittsburgh diner. I had the strawberry hot cakes (reminiscent of a crepe). I like the cake part better at Pamela's than a regular crepe. I don't know what goes in the batter, but it tastes excellent. I asked for it without whipped cream, because it's pretty sweet.

VdZqPTMJBU5o7-yWCM2eCw.text: Very Good Food we loved it alllll I loved the pancakes and my dude hashbrowns was delicious my bacon was good and the ham was awesome :P

gSVCYyP4Ekum0IeeACaXbA.text: I had a few friends that recommended Pamela's to me and I was not disappointed. I really love the hotcakes. I ended up getting their special: apple caramel and walnut. My favorite part is the crispiness on the edges. The service was also great and everyone was very friendly.

ybsbaEeHIbCW0qJtC8nvoA.text: Had a quick breakfast while visiting local colleges. This place is so popular that there was often a line of people waiting, but it seems to move quickly. The pancakes are great.

vYtB8S9woeWd_A9vzZg3Qg.text: The kitchen staff is very irritating because I had to make a couple trips back inside to have my take -out to be right. Very unprofessional and horrid.

DnB5pHWlmsJ66Z2iOnWPVw.text: I love coming here. They are quick, but still polite. Endless coffee refills and an upbeat attitude make it a nice start to the morning.

By1al-KqkOT3ZUqQWJM9nA.text: Usually a long wait, but worth it.  Get the California French Toast.

721gkuJ1IrVeNzshgQUe9w.text: Good and great that I got in right away (summer). Pretty standard brunch fare. A lot of rather loud college kids but it was noon on a Sunday so I understand.  Tried the specialty crepe/pancakes (Chocolate banana) and it was good for a few bites but really sweet. The crepe underneath was great!

wH2q93g3QdNPXWlB3jdUYA.text: We had Greek chicken wrap,  western omelette,  and California French toast.  All meals were great except for the 1inch, sharp, thick sliver of wood we found in the the chicken wrap... maybe added for more fiber. We told the waitress and she gave us the wood sliver meal for free.  We will definitly go back but we'll be wary of foreign objects.

HLVXidJER532DGPGyHvxGw.text: I work in Oakland and my co-workers and I frequently go to Pamela's to celebrate birthdays. There is no better place for a medium-sized group's b-day breakfast than Pamela's! The staff are friendly and never give us an guff for separate checks. The atmosphere i.e. the board games and trivia questions on the table, are great ice breakers/discussion points when we're done bitching about work. The food is always satisfying. I love that one of the side options is tomato slices, a healthy alternative to hash browns. And the prices are great as well, so it's never an issue for our group to have to wait until the next paycheck before we can go. I'm also a big fan of the the crepe hotcakes, which I haven't had in a while, but am glad to know they are there, just in case I decide to throw caution to the wind and have carbs at one of these gatherings.

dE0B3ueRDnjAXOMVcoxPLg.text: I come for the pancakes, I leave having to loosen my belt a few notches.  If you like pancakes, you must try Pamela's crepe pancakes--they're amazing.  The potatoes are OK, but the eggs and breakfast meats aren't anything special.  The cash only policy is inconvenient, but managable.

DOu-hwiHdm33dity7pSTXg.text: We went to Pamela's on our First Steeler's Weekend. They were lined up waiting on tables - but this one is a local favorite worth the wait! I had an Omelet and their famous Lyonnais potatoes - delicious! My husband had their pancakes also - he loved it as well. Prices are reasonable. Service was great. The atmosphere in the older Strip District restaurant was very cool. I will definitely return when in the area and recommend this as well as Primanti Bros as Pittsburgh staples that you absolutely cannot miss out on when in Pittsburgh.  We will definitely go back! This business is CASH ONLY so no credit cards allowed...

PeobVN7VH4G0issV_nrjAQ.text: Coffee sucks!  Great service and the pancakes are light and laced,  I had it Strawberrys, whipped cream and chunks of brown sugar. Total decadence.   Word on the street was that Obama flew the chef to the White House for pancakes, I have no idea if that is True, but it is very believable.   But at the end of the day our waitress said the staff agreed about how bad the coffee was.

tdwTVjlH9AfNyDr9YJ33yQ.text: This place was literally the worst breakfast I've had in 6 years of traveling around the country. DO NOT EAT HERE!!!

ASFe4Qlo4IubGPiLxU1Weg.text: I came around 11:40 AM for brunch and ordered the Morning After Breakfast Special with chocolate chip and banana pancakes. While the entire diner was packed, I was disappointed that I did not receive my food until 12:07 PM. With regard to the quality of food, it was good. The eggs (over easy) were cooked exactly to order. The pancakes had a cooked amount of fluff to them and weren't thick and carb-loaded like IHOP. Price of $10 is also fair.

Jx0OFWhZxbG67KJvAvIFJw.text: Wow, just like old times.  Used to come here often when i was a Pitt student 1997-2002.  Great service and great breakfast spread.  Only accepts cash.  Great alternative to the chain breakfast joints.

rc8r9rv2ockKkW97OJiwcw.text: 3.5 stars, really. When we were in college, Pamela's was THE brunch place of choice, and I doubt much has changed if you're a Carnegie Mellon or Pitt student. But now that I've been out in the adult world, I have to admit that Pamela's is more about the nostalgia than the food for me.  To be clear, their crepes, omelettes, and Lyonnaise potatoes are fantastic. Greasy, but delicious. Everything else is fine, but nothing to write home about.  Pamela's is a Pittsburgh tradition, though, and I do think that counts for something. Don't knock it till you try it, and definitely try it once or twice. Be prepared to wait if you're going at a peak time (like brunch on a weekend) but other than that, I would say I've always had good service.  Tip: they do not accept credit cards, so be sure you have cash. Also, parking can be tough, so give yourself time to look around the side streets for a spot.

2ehSwrwDxmBlynwgf_c7VA.text: Cheap diner with average brunches. It's a safe go-to if you want to have brunch out as long as you have cash. I'm a big eater and always feel full and satisfied after a visit. Service is quick, and the employees are friendly.

YKPVWmsLq5n2jDaiVXj3cg.text: Good breakfast spot, quick seating and service. I would recommend the chorizo and eggs, and the banana chocolate pancakes.  The staff was friendly and the decor was neat, with old board games on the wall. Bring cash.

uEdqje6bYeyz2OFdsU4WhA.text: Great brunch spot! I had the sausage and egg omelette, and my boyfriend had the tex mex omelette. They were both delicious! The service was also very quick and friendly. I highly recommend!

8eSNPNQjQDIDLGcd5SEK_w.text: Pamela's has great old-school diner vibes. We had the banana walnut hotcakes and lyonais potatoes.   The home fries were super buttery, flavorful and crispy. They were great home fries.   The hotcake wasn't too sweet, I especially liked the crispiness on the edges.   The wait to sit down was definitely shorter than they said, but the food doesn't come out right away.   Overall, I would definitely try to check out a Pamela's in Pittsburgh!

Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. banana walnut hotcake

_yEGO1IbZJbUB6xBIs3FDQ.text: Overpriced and malnutritioned.   Paid 20$ for 1 waffle, two (not even real) eggs, and two slices of bacon? The waitress told me I could not substitute my pancakes for a waffle and that I would have to pay 7$ extra to do so. The waffle was unimpressive, they used eggbeater eggs, and the bacon was clearly baked in an over to produce quantities instead of fried in a Pandora quality.

9JrkP4rPxtAIn18ziJcIfg.text: Even though I lived in Oakland for 4 years, I've only been here twice...! The morning I moved out of Oakland my parents were dying to try this place. We went as soon as it opened and were seated, served, and ate pretty quickly.  My dad loved his pancakes and was surprised when he got flat, crispy pancakes instead of fluffy ones. My mom and I split the spinach & feta omelet with egg whites, toast, and potatoes. It was the PERFECT sized breakfast since we had a giant dinner the night before.  The hype around this place is worth it. Great service and atmosphere. I'm glad my parents got to experience it before I left Oakland and without the huge crowd that's usually there!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

lU-qD_Fdr6u6_ZY2ilPgWQ.text: As a Pitt student, I hear a lot of hype surrounding Pamela's. I have been here several times, and I still think it deserves all of the hype. This place is cash only, but prices are very reasonable. You can get a huge plate of food for easily under $10. My go-to's are Gail's Favorite Eggs and the strawberry specialty hotcakes.   The hotcakes are very thin and somewhat crepe-like, but the flavor and texture distinguishes them as pancakes. They are not overly sweet, and the edges of the hotcakes are deliciously crispy and buttery. The strawberry hotcakes come with sour cream and brown sugar inside. At first I was skeptical, but I was amazed when I first tried it. These may be the best pancakes I have ever had.   Gail's Favorite Eggs are topped with the perfect amount of cream cheese and scallions. I ask for my lyonnaise potatoes extra crispy. The rye roast is also very good.   I love the simplicity of Pamela's. Put that together with an awesome menu and delicious hotcakes and you're golden. I'm sure I will be back here many more times to come.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gail&#39;s Favorite Eggs
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry Specialty Hotcakes

-N874SadyGR7gzlLkqV9Ww.text: Always enjoy our meals at Pamela's!   Parking: Going to be a little tough in Oakland but we managed to find a spot nearby.  Service: Zero wait time to get a table. Certainly one of the benefits of paying them a visit during the week. Getting in on the weekend can be extremely tough! The service was quick and prompt.  Food: I'm a huge breakfast fan but I went with the buffalo chicken wrap and it didn't disappoint! My wife had the pancakes and they're killer to!  Price: Most breakfast spots are going to be pretty reasonable and this is no different. Great food for a great price!

6JGonQHpMM-eqsMGSGU0uQ.text: This place is good. I'd probably give it more stars if it weren't for all they hype or doesn't line up to. Cash only? Yikes.   Service lacks and does the atmosphere.  It's ok. But I'm not drinking the kool aid.

-jdIcQHY9scS3bV3_UlKIQ.text: Get here early and expect a wait, but well worth it.  Quick service keeps the line moving so it's not as bad as it may appear. Eight of us sat down for breakfast and covered a good part of the menu, from Chorizo Hash, Pittsburgh Hash, Morning After and Banana Walnut Hotcake.  Reasonably priced and full of flavor with some unique offerings. Hash with sauerkraut and kielbasa? Sure. Jalapeno hash?  Delicious.   Attendees ranged from high school age to middle school and in between.

LefTHSgQ18X7pPiGzOjuUA.text: Great breakfast place but you have to come early or you will have a long wait for a table.  There pancakes are large and super thin with crispy edges - crepe like.   They are flavorful and options for toppings.   The French bread croissant was a big hit at my table except for me as I don't like nuts on it in my food.   They only accept cash.  Prices are reasonable.

1s9n3vhRCeiKrThqxytaTg.text: Pam's is a breakfast/brunch spot you must try at least once if you're new to Pitt campus! They don't try hard to appear super hip/modern/aesthetic, but they instead have this retro interior with very fair prices and massive portions!  First, I'll talk about the hotcakes. I've only tried the strawberry one, but it is absolutely delicious. If you have a huge sweet tooth like me, it's a must-try! I just think it's a little too heavy/oily so you will definitely have a food coma afterwards.  Second, the omelettes are sooo filling. There are a lot of omelette options and they range from classic (like the corned beef & swiss) to unique (like the Tex-Mex). Both are very well made with generous amounts of food. And it comes with a plate full of 4 pieces of toast (white, rye, wheat - so many options!) and potatoes!   Each entree is around $10 which I think is very good for the amount of food you get. Plus, the staff have always been kind to us whenever we went. The main downside is that it is cash-only, so make sure you visit the ATM before you eat here!  In summary, come with a friend and share a sweet & savory dish. Both are heavy but satisfying!

Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry hotcake
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside Tex-Mex omelette

uUDDF-SEgqH3dTMwrSNN3g.text: Pamela's is a classic brunch spot (and American diner food in general) in Pittsburgh. Portions are big, and you can't forget about the hot cakes here!   Juice is a little expensive.

Bj93nPGtVcCs-y1sGQGrhQ.text: There is pretty much always a wait for Pamela's. If you want to go try it out, the best time to do it is in the summer when a lot of Pitt students aren't in Oakland. That way you don't have to wait an hour for a table. It's a bit packed tight in there. It's also cash only.   But you can't help but love it! It's so cute and the wait staff is usually pretty friendly. The food won't necessarily blow your mind, but there aren't a lot of diners around Oakland and when you really want diner food this place will definitely do the trick. I've never heard anybody say anything bad about their food.  I recommend the potatoes! They're delish.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3pV5zOC2xp1QYO1L7KcVsQ.text: Such a Pittsburgh classic! I've visited Pittsburgh twice within the last year and stopped at Pamela's both times. Different locations. It's always busy especially on the weekend so make sure you come early if you don't wanna wait too long. They have a new system where they put you on an electronically list so they can text you when they're ready which makes it a lot easier. Always remember that they only take cash!   Now to the food...I would say my eyes were bigger than my stomach but honestly I ate most of my food. Always make sure you get the breakfast potatoes; they were a little more mushy this time but still super delicious! Their hotcakes are unique; they're super thin but this makes it perfect for when they add things like nutella and bananas and other tasty things. I will say when you start adding on a bunch of food it definitely gets a little pricey for a diner, but I will keep coming back whenever I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WwdT21jNJyddWSlurEnHmQ.text: Today was the first time in Oakland Pamela. I was a frequent visitor for Squirrel Hill's. So I guess I have some comparisons to share.  First, the interior. Oakland's one is obvious more vibrant and colorful, whereas Squirrel hill location offers some homey and classical-diner vibe. There is no superior one. I enjoyed both.  Second, the food. I always get the omelette. Both locations have generous serving size, which would certainly leave you full for the entire morning. I would say the veggies in my omelet was more thoroughly cooked and well-seasoned in the squirrel hill location than in Oakland one. But no one cares about vegetables for breakfast that much so I still love my omelette in Oakland location.  Finally, the service is impeccable. You pay at the counter but they will take good care of you. Bottomless coffee mug IS bottomless. I obviously over-caffeinated after eating there. But I guess that speaks to how frequently my mug got filled.  Anyway, Pamela, it is Pamela. Whatever people say, I've got to bring people visiting from out-of-state here to eat. All five stars for local favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie Omelet

xE182mMFoZjVcxFJ8YojMQ.text: Like the other locations, I'm a big fan of this one as well.  As long as I can get the pancakes that are as big as my ass I'm happy.   Big, glorious, scrumptious pancakes.  I'm hooked on the hot cakes. Flap jacks for days you guys.  The more butter an syrup the better.  Give me a stack. Stat!

ay_SaHTFdZv31j4tz2c2fw.text: This is the go-to Pamela's location for both me and the department I work in. We make any old excuse to schedule a group Pamela's breakfast be it a birthday, first day of spring, service anniversary, you name it! (Yes, we have a problem.) The staff are unfailingly friendly, efficient, and helpful with pushing together tables and making sure everyone's drink orders are in. A bonus are the hundreds of vintage board games displayed on the walls. They're an instant conversation starter!  I typically order the eggs with toast, meat, and potatoes. Sometimes I get the corned beef hash instead, which is super filling and difficult to finish but also #worthit every time. We like to order "table pancakes" (calorie free, right?) but I can't weigh in on their quality due to having a dairy allergy. I will say they look like absolute perfection though! I haven't ventured into their lunch menu much, although once during lent I went with a coworker to try their Friday fish special. The crispy giant cod fillet and double fried shoestring fries blew me away! I saw it on their regular menu, so I'm sure I'll get it again next time I want fried fish. Overall there's not much more to say about Pamela's except I can see why it's an institution here and why the Obamas graced it with their presence also. It's everything a solid diner should be without the grime and salty attitudes you sometimes encounter. Keep it up!

iegvhLgmlixWsZI5YV6s7g.text: A great place to go for Sunday brunch--but beware the long waits! I absolutely love getting the side of potatoes with my hotcakes and the free coffee refills are so appreciated. The diner is accommodating for all party sizes which is awesome and they even have trivia cards sitting on the table for you to play while you wait for your food!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

myLz9Unbv7bdPNeRJfYncA.text: Get there early and if you don't want to wait to long, sit at the breakfast bar if any seats are open.  Crepe style pancakes are a must and any of the hashes.  Remember its cash only though.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cranking out breakfast at Pamela&#39;s

6BVr6qh3effpW3tg-FICcw.text: Basic diner style breakfast spot. Pancakes, eggs omelets etc. Service is good. Food came out super fast but overall a solid spot for breakfast. Just keep in mind its cash only

hFuHsv3y4Kvca4WOw1pz9g.text: Came here on sat mid morning.  Roughly 20min wait and sounds like you can join wait list online so if then that's an added bonus.  Wait was worth it and the hype was all True.  Had croissant French toast with caramel sauce and walnuts. Just enough sweetness and lots of walnuts.  I had chorizo patty on the side. Lil spicy but with the French toast it was perfect sweet and salty and spice. My fam had blue berry and strawberry crepe like hotcakes stuffed with fruit and brown sugar and they killed it ! My younger son who is not a fan of breakfast food had buffalo chicken wrap and it was gone in seconds. Definitely tried the Lyonnais potato for the table and while I was gone for 3 min to put more money for parking, it was gone and heard it was that good. Waitress Service and host were on point and very pleasant.  Decor was fun and clean. The only reason I didnt give 5 stars is because the coffee was very weak and there was a dish det taste from a coffee mug on first sip.  Guess at least proves it was washed. It is unlimited coffee so maybe that's why it is weak. Other than that definitely a place to eat !

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blueberry, brown sugar and sour cream stuffed hotcakes with whipped cream.
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Croissant french toast

SNMUdeUrENvXpVzMzq5xtQ.text: Pamela's is the one breakfast in Pittsburgh I crave, and I rarely get over to the Oakland location these days. As always, the Morning After meal is delicious as always. I'm not a pancake guy normally, but you really just can't go wrong with the crepe-style pancakes... and the best sausage in Pittsburgh in my opinion.  HOWEVER, please start including a small amount of the potatoes again. Adding them as a side with some coffee and your meal is now over $15. It's more food than I can eat, but it's exclusion is a bummer! They've always (as far as I know) kept it off the menu for the "Big Lincoln" in Millvale, but other locations they used to be included.

UyyxSWGPCJkMDA628Zruuw.text: A hotcake is basically a pancake with slightly crispy edges.  Between the three of us, we tried the strawberry hotcake, the banana walnut hotcake, and a plain hotcake.  They were decent but not fantastic -a tad too much of that fried feeling.  Of the three, the strawberry was the best because the tartness of the strawberry and sweetness of the brown sugar blended well.  The banana hotcake and the plain one were sort of bland (pancake syrup did the trick, though).  The "morning after" breakfast special is a hotcake with eggs and meat (bacon, sausage, or ham) for $6.95 (+$2 to upgrade to the strawberry or banana one).  I asked for my eggs over medium and they were definitely over easy.  Again, the food was still decent - but I could tell that Pamela's was not famous for their sausage and eggs.  I guess Cleveland wins over Pittsburgh in brunch.

hUsgr25aoYWy1f0PWlYcQg.text: My daughter recommended it to us. We had breakfast there on Monday. The food is good. The service is a kind of rough and rushed.

7dk3wL5tOdqp7nLVFh9gPw.text: If you love pancakes and crepes, you'll love Pam's special hotcakes. They are thicker than crepes but thin enough to be perfectly griddled on each side. They still have the fluffy texture of pancakes and are just amazing with strawberries!  We came here on a snowing winter morning, and it was perfect for a diner experience. We were seated right away and the service was very attentive and friendly. I'm not a morning person, but Pamela's makes it great.

qH6gC1jd2Ox1nHCOEK_zwQ.text: We ordered the Tex Mex omelette and the pancakes. The pancakes were horribly oily and tasted ok . Very unhealthy and heavy.  The omelette was stuffed with chorizo which was also average.  I dint think this place was that great. Quite below average. Even in spite of the rush, the food came out quick.  But I'll try the other ones the next time.

wWxKofgbpzNh6ipuC8-T0A.text: Stopped by for breakfast on a Saturday. It was around 10am and the place was filled. Fortunately, when my friend and I arrived we were able to be seated immediately. Once you enter the restaurant, you immediately notice the board game wall decor which makes the place look uber colorful. No complaints.   We decided to try the strawberry hotcakes and the corned beef hash omelette. The hotcakes were different. I was expecting pancake-looking food but it came out as more of a crepe-ish hotcake texture, which I liked. The batter wasn't thick and the combination of the sour cream, strawberries, and whip cream were delish. The corned beef hash omelette on the other hand was pretty ordinary.

6gAXesPlRenG-eJq9Yj7cw.text: Great little spot we found on Yelp, and right down from our hotel! The chorizo was yummy, the fruit bowl was fresh and delicious, and the atmosphere was fun!

WKGVn9FxzHf2VAYeo0959g.text: This is your typical neighborhood diner. Many locations in Pittsburgh and they are always crowded so you know you are getting good food. Many a times I have been for breakfast and my go to is the chocolate chip pancakes with bananas or the pancakes with strawberries and sour cream both delicious. On my past visit I went for lunch- my first time trying lunch but you can always get breakfast all day. I went with a turkey sandwich with american cheese ( really the only kind of cheese they had). When it was served it was literally slices of turkey breast and a piece of cheese on a roll. I had to ask them to bring lettuce and tomatoes for me to put on. I asked for mustard and they were out. How could that be but luckily they ran across the street to buy 2 bottles at the Riteaid. An extra star for that staff member. The sandwiches come with a choice of fries or their famous lyonnaise potatoes. Always recommend the potatoes.  The service is fair and a fun place to try when visiting Pittsburgh.

kTkjmgqeBTIiyhkJfcy7nw.text: I love this place, that's all there is to it!  I get breakfast at Pamela's at least twice a week, same thing each time: the Tex-Mex omelet is fantastic and so are the potatoes. The price is just what you'd expect a diner to be, which fits my college budget just right. The staff are very attentive and I've never had wait longer than 10 minutes for my food. The coffee is good and the atmosphere is fine; they play a lot of classic rock and oldies, which much better than any of the new music being played at other restaurants around the Pitt campus.   Lunch is good, too. Pamela's a good selection of salads and sandwiches. The chicken salad comes in a big bowl with fries, and it's very good. Now I'm not a pancake person, so I can't vouch for any of the hotcakes or crepes or whatnot, but all of the other breakfast and lunch food is good and homemade. In short, Pamela's is a good, family-owned restaurant that has excellent food and service for a reasonable price.

ry2LpoUQz1F3NIJrNjQxWg.text: a decent place for breakfast. More along the lines of a greasy spoon ; but cleaner with better than typical service.

l5F_R_BTDo5M2vsV2RCEeA.text: Subpar coffee but delicious hotcakes reminiscent of Amsterdam. Excellent service.

9BJfeSyE_nOntxoQGkJQ2A.text: Really delicious crepe style pancakes here - you can get them plain or stuffed with bananas and topped with whipped cream.  The staff is friendly and it's great for brunch.    The wait is pretty long on a weekend though - almost 30 min for a table for 5.

5PCSwT4w_d-l0QVDgNwgJg.text: Treating your Pitt student to breakfast or brunch at Pamela's is a time honored tradition!  Your student will appreciate the huge servings of delicious comfort food, and you will appreciate the moderate prices (but remember, it is cash only). Definitely try the some of their famous crepe pancakes!  They are thin, crispy around the edges, and the size of a dinner plate. The strawberry stuffed ones are the best.   This location is right in the midst of Pitt campus and so is always crowded with college students. However, don't be put off by the wait, service is fast and the tables turn over quickly.   The ambiance is casual, colorful and fun, with old board game boxes and gameboards decorating the walls.  Recommend!

gUQMN43mbteE9ucLDSfcqQ.text: Nom nom nom. Food here is seriously good, but ... and I hesitate to say this, but they just give you way too much :( It took me 4 more meals over 2 days to finish my potatoes and pancakes. I feel bad not eating food that tastes this good, but I can only eat pancakes for so many meals...

70rCv0n7W-mCfwLesqhVuA.text: This location is the diner staple of Oakland. Its extensive breakfast menu makes it a popular destination for many students (and their visitors); so much so, that there is usually a line out the door on weekends. Pamela's has limited hours, but if you can get there during off-peak hours, then you're in for a pleasant meal.

MqeNpJzC06WK4yMHNvNPnw.text: The line is always long on Saturdays and Sundays from 10-12. So expect to wait just a little while if you want to go on those days. I would say that the food is okay, although I have had better. The service is so quick, which is really nice when I am hungry in the morning. I should order something that they are known for in order to give them a better rating.

-ndiHH5G5rk49TkbG7h_HQ.text: Happy busy yummy breakfast joint.  Good coffee - nice service - bustling clientelle.  Nommy Lyonnaise potatoes.  French bananas on Whole Wheat French toast.  Boardgames all over the wall - just like my kitchen!

H7gWqzo56APaDvVBnvG4zQ.text: We stopped for brunch before a Pitt basketball game on a Saturday morning. When we decided to eat here i knew i had to try the hot cakes i had heard so much about. We both ordered the "Morning After Special". 2 eggs, 2 hot cakes and sausage links. The hot cakes were so unlike any I had ever had. Thin, crispy edges and they lived up to the hype! I really enjoyed them! Fun decor with quick, friendly service at a very reasonable price.  FYI... CASH sales only!!

kCimQ2W1NF1w9_7_k2wnZQ.text: Brunch is my favorite meal of the day, so of course I was scouting for a nice spot for our first morning in Pittsburgh. Per the suggestion of my co-worker's [native] friend, we decided to check out one of the Pamela's locations. We knew we found it when there was a large crowd waiting in front of it. It was a bit deterring but the restaurant was so highly suggested that I wanted to go for it anyway. Turns out, the wait was only 20 minutes long. When there's a crowd that big outside of popular Atlanta eateries, it's usually at least an hour and a half wait! Twenty minutes gave us enough time for a casual stroll around the block and back.  There are two seating areas inside - the game room, and.. the other room. Not sure what it's called, but we were seated in the gaming room and I was glad. This room is very interactive, with old, classic board games pinned up on the walls, as well as classic trivia / card games on the tables for patrons to play with. Talk about nostalgia! Guess Who, anyone?  Looking around after we all ordered, I noticed that a LOT of other people were leaving without finishing their meals. I figured that either the food wasn't good or the portion sizes are monstrous! Seeing as how packed the place was, I assumed the latter.  Food wise, I was actually a little disappointed, at least in what I ordered. They're apparently pretty famous for their hotcakes, even Obama likes 'em! So my mind was made up and I ordered the banana walnut hotcakes. The insane amount of crushed walnuts inside ended up making everything taste really try. And their portion size is indeed massive. My order came with two giant hotcakes, of which I could only stomach one. The beau ordered the tex-mex omelet which I thought was delicious! We both agreed that they could have done with a lot less salsa though. Definitely get the lyonnaise potatoes as your side. The other guys ended up ordering the other items I considered getting, so I got to mooch off them. :)  Warning: cash only!

xj00UYRTDQezglhOHPFPtA.text: Love this place. Great atmosphere diner. Breakfast, brunch and lunch only. This location cash only.

N6EcUvuy0zq4Z3jZDmcM4g.text: Pamela's is a local chain that my wife had heard great things about and really wanted to try. I had been once before for breakfast, and overall had pretty good, experiences.   Me, my wife Carla, and 11 month old son went for brunch, around 11 o-clock. It was Pitt's first weekend back, so there were plenty new college students, their parents, and people who had come into town for the Steelers pre-season game.   The wait was long, but it seems that Pamela's is known for this and this was to be expected. Initially when I asked about the wait I was told, "don't worry, no too long." 15 minutes later we did have a seat with plenty of space for us and our 11-month old. Everyone was very nice, friendly, and helpful.  For this visit, I tried the Tex-Mex omelet (sans chorizo) which was very tasty, if not presented very nicely. It basically looked like mush but frmo a taste standpoint had just the right blend of salsa, cheese, sour cream, and guac to taste good. Come to think of it, it's probably impossible to blend salsa, cheese, sour cream, and guac and not serve it looking like mush.   Carla was excited to try the "hot-cakes" that all the employee's T-shirts raved about, and she tried the banana walnut. I tried them, too. While I thought they were tasty, Carla's complaint was that they really didn't seem like pancakes at all. I have to agree. They looked more likely slightly thicker and slightly crispier crepes, right down to being served wrapped in a cyclindrical fashion with the banana and walnut stuffed inside. There was a ton of walnut and banana, though, which was nice. Carla tends to enjoy thick, fluffy pancakes, so they were a bit disappointing.   Leo had a single scrambled egg, which they were kind enough to make. He seemed to be a fan, which is new since he hadn't enjoyed scrambled eggs, yet.   The price was reasonable and the service  was friendly, accurate, and prompt.   Overall, we'd potentially come back to Pamela's, though I might want to try one of the other locations that has been better reviewed. As we're still getting to know the breakfast/brunch scene, this place wasn't half-bad.

Zd1vTvmZXkbs55kLMC6OXQ.text: Great breakfast. Love the crepe pancakes! Nice service. Reasonably  priced but remember  to bring cash.  Like  most good restaurants  there  may  be  a wait depending  on  the  time of day.

ZMDY7Lk-F-FskDy6y56G6A.text: I went to Pamela following my friends. Her strong recommendation turned out to be good for all of us. The atmosphere was cool and staff was kind even though we had a lot of questions and took long time to choose our menu.   Crispy crepes with sour cream, strawberry and banana were so delicious that we can't have time to chat. Mashed potato and omelette stuffed with meat and vegetables were good, too.   One thing I want to tell you is that there is no need to have additional potato when you order a set menu. We had double potatoes (side dish of a set menu and an independent order) so we left a little.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crepes , omelette and coffee

Qbt1ak3wG8iDK7p-5h1EnQ.text: Three words: YUUUUU UUUUUU MMMY!!!! We went here after reading fellow yelper reviews. Great decision! Other yelpers commented on the possible long wait. We used the No Wait app and it helped. Our server Jordan was awesome (and cute)!   We ordered the Croissant French Toast, Pamela's famous pancakes, lyonnis potatoes, eggs and bacon. Our bellies are very happy!!! The pancakes are like Swedish pancakes just alot bigger.   My only criticsm......Offer REAL Maple syrup and honey as options. Even if there's an upcharge.

Gw_c-0p_LKeXYzFP2Q0g-A.text: 1. it is actually 3.5, I don't think it can be rounded to 4. 2. Tax-Max Omelet was good, generous, filling, will go for it again 3. Coffee was just coffee 4. Juice was fresh 5. Place has a name, could do better 6. Banana Hotcake was good.

46cD1xx7p-ryHc8k7V-URg.text: I was in town for a training and a group of 5 of us came here for breakfast.  The decor is interesting with retro board games all over the walls from several different decades.  We each ordered our meals for the morning. And I was surprised at how quickly the order came out. I would have expected 10 minutes or so but our order was on the table within 5 minutes.  I ordered the famous hot cakes with a side of bacon. I found the crepe style pancakes flavorful and prepared well. They are a large plate sized portion of pancakes. I had no problem finishing it and was clearly full. The thin nature of the pancakes take a little getting used to. The bacon was not crispy enough for me, but I had no problems with it either.  Server was friendly and speedy. She also handled dividing our checks up.   I would recommend this location. There are plenty of food options and they are exceptional.

asvtel8ZmH8FonQxu9ChHQ.text: I came here several times already, I really like it as breakfast or fast meal between classes. The only thing is they only take cash. So need to make sure have it before come in.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taste very good, but too much for me

o84DAp386WZ6fndLdY5CWg.text: The dishes taste good but there are so many customers. We waited for almost 45 minutes! But to be honest, it deserves.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. White bread &amp; omelette &amp; potatoes

Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I love it! It&#39;s can be a meal rather than a dessert! The cold cream &amp; hot cover as well as banana &amp; melt chocolate match well!
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The a little salty sausage matches the French toast so good!!!

NEaXV4U8VJGT4kMJgGDq4A.text: Consistently delicious food. Able to adapt most foods for any allergies. Have visited many times. Just ate there. Yummy.

DmN1Lx27ATr5vaQqQGfTig.text: A Pittsburgh classic and must! First time in Pittsburgh and had to check this place out. The decor is fun and the service and food is amazing! We got the Morning after breakfast special and the Tex-Mex omelette. Both were very flavorful and filling! Our server was also very attentive and friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

3Bo-OqWJxmeVdRBQr1am8w.text: Best breakfast/brunch in Pittsburgh! The hot cakes are a must, and if you're looking for a really good time, croissant French toast will rock your tastebuds.   Service is quick during peak hours - I waited only 20 minutes after putting my name on a list behind 15-20 other parties.   Solid diner with a cool specialty niche.. Just don't forget to bring cash!!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu

IWsjmzLIUF203wF9A6OQCw.text: I had an average experience overall at Pamela's. Parking was difficult, but that's usually the case anywhere in Oakland. I went with a group on a busy Sunday morning, so I expected the service to be a little slow and it was. No big deal. The restaurant is small and when it's super busy like it was it can definitely get really crowded inside. I got the banana walnut hotcakes and their "Famous Lyonnaise" potatoes. The hotcakes were fine, they very sweet and crepe-like, as they're described on the menu. They were good, but not anything I personally found particularly amazing. Putting butter or syrup on the hotcakes makes them turn soggy really quickly because of how thin they are. The potatoes were really tasty, they were seasoned well and very flavorful. The potatoes were a little expensive for how small of a portion you get. I've definitely had better breakfast experiences elsewhere for the same price, but I wouldn't say I had a bad experience here. Just average.

ubbEEClA_btx3E8hEhzRVg.text: This is a solid breakfast place for sure, and liked the divey diner ambiance.  We had a large group, so it was about 30 minute wait for our table, but once we were seated our server was with us right away to get our drink orders. Once we placed our food order it was only another 10 minutes before our food was out on our table! I tried Gail's favorite eggs, and they were creamy and delicious. My boyfriend had their morning after breakfast with the blueberry hot cakes that were on special. The hot cakes are very unique, almost crepe-like, but really good. The bacon however, was a little thin and crisp. Service was terrific during the entire meal, our coffees never got lower than half a cup.  Overall it was a quick and tasty breakfast, and definitely a place to try at least once.

wZFYkppAWs6jJbgtS8Rs6w.text: Sought out Pamela's on the recommendation of a Pittsburgh resident. My wife and I enjoyed our meals thoroughly, and everything was as we expected for a diner.   The hotcakes are unique, and were delicious with or without syrup -- especially the crispy bits on the edges. The lyonnaise potatoes (recommended to us) were also good.  The service was brief, but more than adequate.   Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interior
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two eggs over easy, ham, and hotcakes.

WQhAzu-W2L_Vq5AKWbSrHw.text: Visiting from DC- easily the best breakfast I think I've ever had! The potatoes are incredible. Would highly recommend the chocolate chip banana hot cakes too. It's cash only but it's worth the wait in line on weekends

Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

eQPjBKLRASFTpqDZrHCkIg.text: I came here at around 10am for Sun. breakfast with my parents about a year ago when they were visiting PGH. I ordered the blueberry and sour cream filled crepes, and they were delicious!  My mom ordered the strawberry hotcakes and I forget what my dad ordered, but they enjoyed theirs very much, as well. The food here is diner food, so it is on the buttery/greasy side, but the pancakes are consistently good.   The decor is board-game themed, which added a playful element to the experience of eating here.  I believe we waited about 10 min. to be seated, and I don't have any complaints about the service.  This place accepts cash only, so remember to hit the ATM before coming.  Having Sun. breakfast here was a great ending to a fun weekend, as well as a way to introduce my folks to one more unique PGH eatery!

UNrb1xdets7-nkazkWWrGw.text: What a great old fashioned diner. The scrambled eggs (I ordered Gail's favourites) were perfectly made. They use fresh eggs for their egg dishes, which is increasingly becoming uncommon. Danielle, our server, couldn't be friendlier. The decor is great as well and the rates reasonable. I recommend it wholeheartedly!

fPZbUhVDa6mGYVoS1d6pjA.text: Great food !!!  Had their over easy eggs with toast and potatoes awesome :) the only down side is the space I wish they had more room it's tight

Bk1q2z2FKM90maL-4BJwTQ.text: Whether you're meeting up with old friends or you're just looking for a nice, filling meal, Pams is the place for you.  The friendly staff will serve you up an experience and meal you'll never forget.  If you're an omelette person, the Tex Mex omelette is a choice you cannot go wrong with.  Stop by Pam's sometime!

G7hLwtaXRHjtTBphvCiHpg.text: This was an overwhelmingly positive experience! We were able to reserve tables for 15 people on graduation weekend. The staff were super helpful in setting tables aside for us, and I could not say enough good things about our waitress. We had family coming internationally who didn't speak much English so she was extremely kind and patient while we translated their orders. She was so good with keeping our many waters filled and never seemed impatient or exhausted by our large party!   The food was incredible and exactly what you'd hope for at a good diner. I had the corned beef hash with bacon. The hash was amazing! Salty and greasy, and really hit the spot. I also tried some of the chocolate chip and banana crepes which were decadent and sweet, super delicious.  The only thing was that they don't have tables big enough, so we had to break up into 3 separate tables. Otherwise everything way exceeded my standards. Definitely highly recommended!

dX7m3L8GyX4Kfh5AmTG5uw.text: Delicious brunch, quick service and interesting retro board game decorations.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strawberry hotcake (front) strawberry french toast (back)

jbF1Ua_-WOSl1ZtLLQXMPg.text: Probably the best breakfast(s) I've ever had. Went 2 days in a row. Pancakes - their thin stye, amazing. Hash browns - which I don't even like, usually: So tasty. Good fresh coffee. Everything was fun, fast-moving, friendly, yummy. It's why a good diner is so great. And why it's so sad when you go to a mediocre diner. This is worth a trip to Pittsburgh just to eat here. Go your first morning there so you can go back again and again. Cash only!

CzFte7Pq0MvKdqY4Ht-AXw.text: First of all, the decor of this place is great! The multitude of board games posted around the tiny diner makes you feel nostalgic, happy, and kid-like. Secondly, the menu is simple but the food is good. I think the French toast is my favorite! And for you Pitt students: they take Panther Funds!

4TfA34xMpD-OvYYwKa8_BQ.text: I think the person who said that breakfast is the most important meal of the day had Pamela's Diner in mind. I had a sausage and cheese omelette with banana and walnut crepes and home fries. I feel a food coma coming on. Easily in the top 5 of best breakfast spots in Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pBpmL9RJN8ZIUocyB1TA0Q.text: This breakfast was 10/10.  Wait is very long but service is quick and great.  The chocolate chip banana pancakes was the best breakfast I ever had.

RFBFE9L0uTCcvhinTN6DtQ.text: We love this restaurant. The best breakfast in Pittsburgh. Unfortunately the seats are so close that the acoustics are awful and one can't communicate without screaming

TdfGaxmF3-ZuqDRmmsgUig.text: Have been here a couple of times. Got mixed feelings. Service is usually very slow... not much space between tables. It's very popular in oakland, never been other locations. The food is good, but it is not as good as the popularity level.

GBG0eLifN360u4SVSo875A.text: One of the best breakfast places I've been to.   The chorizo patties are fabulous!  Highly recommend you stop in for a bite.   First time here and I'll be back when I'm in Pittsburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chorizo and eggs!  You&#39;ve got to try!

hKU4kxRgatJHrwsr9IdEQQ.text: Came here for one of their croissant sandwiches during Oakland's Restaurant Week. It was decent, with a nice portion of crab salad as well as the potatoes (not so sure what's so famous about these, they were good but not particularly memorable). I did wish they heated the croissant though. The surprising thing was that it was ready and brought out to us even faster than ordering a lobster salad sandwich at Quizno's. Probably because they didn't bother heating up the croissant. We also had another side of cole slaw which we found a bit too heavy.  Service left a bit to be desired. It was mostly efficient and focused on getting us seated, taking our orders, and bringing us the food and check at the same time. They didn't really check up on us until we got up to pay at the register.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab salad croissant with home fries

nbQZLk7hWgBOMWiBi6j-sA.text: I usually go here for brunch and their portion definitely soothes the craving. The food is good, but nothing to be bouncing off the walls about. It's just your ordinary all-American breakfast. The service is fast. Good place to meet up with your friends and chit chat over coffee/tea and food.   Pamela's definitely known for their hotcakes...warm and crispy. Give them a try and judge for yourself! And don't forget...CASH ONLY!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana walnut hotcakes
Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Morning after breakfast special

4rpMZOAF-dCUwqdctNzqRw.text: They only take cash, and get there early because the place is always packed. I ate here every AM for a week while on vacation, and the food never disappointed. The french toast with REAL strawberries was delish!

AGou_5VMVe3GFuwqwVqPQQ.text: Staff are always great and food doesn't disappoint, but this is straight diner food - so if you are looking for something fancy - then this isn't your place. Also, they only take cash - so come prepared.

Gj_hwqy11GJINXpZGS3MqQ.text: I stopped between my 2 Dr's appointments. The staff was ok. They gave us time to look over the menu, but really our server wasn't too friendly. She came back once to check on us.  My husband ordered a hot turkey sandwich with fries and he said it was great. I ordered a BLT and fries. The fries were very good, my sandwich was ok. There was no mayo on it and my one piece of bread was brunt.   I thought the prices were a bit high for the food too.   Overall, it was good and it's a nice place to stop and eat somewhere different, when you live 2 hrs away and have a 2 hr break between Dr's appointments.

Ydt91be2Bq67JZmjkPkd_Q.text: Very good diner with breakfast and lunch options! I got the two eggs scrambled with bacon and potatoes which was all very good! The potatoes aren't your average hash browns but they are super yummy. The service was also very good and the food came out so quickly it took maybe 5 minutes. The food was a little greasy but I think that's just the style of the diner and it still tasted good. There also was no wait to eat which was nice even though it seemed very crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two eggs scrambled with bacon, potatoes, and rye toast!

Gt_MVwxursgzeyLGZJgrpQ.text: Tried for the first time today, even though they were super busy we got seated and waited on right away. Our food came seriously within 5 minutes. I got eggs (which were cooked much better than other places), potatoes, bacon and toast. The potatoes were awesome! Had to try a banana chocolate chip pancake...amazing! It's a pet peeve of mine if a server doesn't come back and check on us. She was friendly though. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

N_urN6oo9kW9gp2fefp3Kw.text: Usually goes to the one in the strip. But we got out late and we know it is gonna be an over an hour wait if we go to the strip, plus it's hard to find a park over there. This location is on no wait, you can put down your name prior to arrival, which can save you 10-15 minutes depends on your location. When I got on no wait, it says 20 minutes wait so I put our name down. Check in was easy because we got there early, we waited for another 5 minutes. Pancake is always a must have! Potato was good too. The bacon is always my least fav here. Too thin, they should get strip meat store's bacon. Ah, some fresh squeezed juice, Then this place would be prefect!

oRKRQUSmRtX4EEiR4zYPOg.text: Pamela's is one of those places I keep taking people to because it feels like I should as a Pittsburgh host. As a restaurant, it's not really my favorite, but it definitely still has its own charm. I'd call it three and a half stars.   +/- Generous portions. It's normal to pig out at Pamela's, but it's also easy to hate yourself a little after you're done.  + Tasty food, both savory and sweet. I like the hotcakes and Lyonnaise potatoes especially! + Lots of familiar breakfast food options, so it's a nice place to take guests to.  - Definitely don't expect to be eating healthy. Butter, carbs, and sugar are all on the menu today.  - The service has always struck me as pretty brusque. To be fair, they are constantly rushing around with the amount of people they have to serve, but it's not my cup of tea.  - You'll often have to wait at peak hours, like breakfast/brunch on the weekend.  - Cash only. You bring your check to the counter when you finish and pay there.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. croissant French toast, drizzled with caramel sauce and walnuts. kind of looked and tasted like the hotcakes!

YYjt5xaDjtIiHyi1Q-YWKw.text: Not bad at all but really overrated. Food is average, prices aren't bad. Inside is kinda weird if you ask me. Shadyside location looks nicer but still pretty average food

L-w6xAQZ_JvK0jPgNulYOg.text: This is a great place to get breakfast. Service is a little slow but it's worth it for the delicious food. I had the tex mex omelet and it was incredible. Just make sure you get something that comes with homefries as a side otherwise you are missing. I also found the board game theme was really unique and gave the diner a nice atmosphere. Definitely stop by here some time, whether you are a student or local resident.

XuF4yEzsxXYfRcSC6Fpefg.text: The crispy crepe style pancakes and chorizo hash are my all time favorites. It's always good and the service is great!

f-5CI6waJXns9Q7rvUjsYw.text: Another Pittsburgh staple, the Pamela's in Oakland is one of my favorites. They are really known for their breakfast and hotcakes, which come with strawberry, banana, chocolate and other varieties. The portions are satisfying and you really can't go wrong with anything on the breakfast menu. I got the 'famous' corn beef hash, and it was particularly delicious, with crispy not soggy beef mixed with their famous potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of P&G's Pamela's Diner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corn beef hash with two eggs over easy and rye bread
